00039 /******************************************************************************/
00040 
00041 Stack::Stack()
00042 {
00043    top = -1;         // Initialize an empty stack
00044    size = MAX_SIZE;  // Initialize a stack of maximum size.
00045 }
00046 
00047 
00048 /******************************************************************************/
00060 /******************************************************************************/
00061 Stack::Stack(int initial_size)
00062 {
00063     // Initialize an empty stack
00064   top = -1;               
00065 
00066   if (initial_size < 0)
00067     size = 0;
00068 
00069     // Set stack to maximum size when input size is oversized
00070   else if (initial_size > MAX_SIZE)
00071     size = MAX_SIZE;
00072 
00073     // Otherwize, set stack size to input size
00074   else
00075     size = initial_size;
00076 } 
00077 
00078 /******************************************************************************/
00092 /******************************************************************************/
00093 void Stack::pushItem(int item)
00094 {
00095     // Check if stack is full
00096   if (isFull())
00097     throw ("Attempting to push when stack is full.");
00098 
00099     // If stack is not full, increment the top index and add the item
00100   top = top + 1;              
00101   items[top] = item;       
00102 }
00103 
00104 
00105 /******************************************************************************/
00118 /******************************************************************************/
00119 int Stack::popItem(void)
00120 {
00121 
00122     // Check if stack is empty
00123   if (isEmpty())
00124     throw ("Attempting to pop when stack is empty.");
00125 
00126   int number = items[top]; // Get the value of top item
00127   top--;                   // Remove the top item
00128   return number;           // Return the value of top item to caller
00129 }
00130 
00131 
00132 /******************************************************************************/
00150 /******************************************************************************/
00151 int Stack::peekAtTop(void) const
00152 {
00153     // Check if stack is empty
00154   if (isEmpty())
00155     return 0;        // Return 0 to caller
00156 
00157   return items[top]; // Return the value of top item to caller
00158 }
00159

00161 /******************************************************************************/
00170 /******************************************************************************/
00171 bool Stack::isEmpty(void) const
00172 {
00173     // if array index is negative,stack is empty
00174   if (top < 0)
00175     return true;
00176   else
00177     return false;
00178 }
00179

00181 /******************************************************************************/
00195 /******************************************************************************/
00196 bool Stack::isFull(void) const
00197 {
00198     // if array index is greater or equal to (size - 1),stack is full
00199   if (top >= size - 1)
00200     return true;
00201   else
00202     return false;
00203 }

00213 void Stack::print(void) const
00214 {
00215     // call the general-purpose version
00216   print(std::cout, 6);
00217 }

00220 /******************************************************************************/
00233 /******************************************************************************/
00234 void Stack::print(std::ostream &stream, int width) const
00235 {
00236     // index of array
00237   int i;       
00238 
00239     // Print out all items in the stack and set width to 6
00240   for (i = 0; i<= top; i++)
00241     stream << std::setw(width) << items[i];
00242   stream << std::endl;
00243 }

00247 /******************************************************************************/
00256 /******************************************************************************/
00257 int Stack::getCount(void) const
00258 {
00259     // Number of items is the top index plus one
00260   return (top + 1);
00261 }

00274 int Stack::getSize(void) const
00275 {
00276     // Returns size from private part of class
